intro: Viticipremna, commonly known as the ironwood tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Central and South America. The plants are characterized by their robust, woody stems and dense foliage, often featuring palmate leaves with five to seven leaflets. Viticipremna species are known for their hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. They are also valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
